title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the Phillips curve, with a downward-sloping short-run and a vertical long-run Phillips curve

  • One point is earned for showing point A that is on the short-run Phillips curve to the right of the long-run Phillips curve.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for correctly labeled graph of the Phillips curve, with a downward-sloping short-run and a vertical long-run Phillips curve

  • One point is earned for showing point A that is on the short-run Phillips curve to the right of the long-run Phillips curve.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for correctly labeled graph of the Phillips curve, with a downward-sloping short-run and a vertical long-run Phillips curve

  • One point is earned for showing point A that is on the short-run Phillips curve to the right of the long-run Phillips curve.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for correctly labeled graph of the Phillips curve, with a downward-sloping short-run and a vertical long-run Phillips curve

  • One point is earned for showing point A that is on the short-run Phillips curve to the right of the long-run Phillips curve.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for calculating the maximum possible change in real GDP: $80 billion.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for calculating the maximum possible change in real GDP: $80 billion.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for calculating the maximum possible change in real GDP: $80 billion.

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for placing point B on the SRPC to the left of point A.

  • One point is earned for showing point B on the short-run Phillips curve between point A and the long-run Phillips curve.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for placing point B on the SRPC to the left of point A.

  • One point is earned for showing point B on the short-run Phillips curve between point A and the long-run Phillips curve.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for placing point B on the SRPC to the left of point A.

  • One point is earned for showing point B on the short-run Phillips curve between point A and the long-run Phillips curve.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for placing point B on the SRPC to the left of point A.

  • One point is earned for showing point B on the short-run Phillips curve between point A and the long-run Phillips curve.

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that the change caused by tax decrease would be smaller because:

  • part of the increase in personal income will be saved rather than consumed, or

  • students may show by calculating the increase in GDP, $60 billion, or

  • because the tax multiplier is smaller than the spending multiplier
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that the change caused by tax decrease would be smaller because:

  • part of the increase in personal income will be saved rather than consumed, or

  • students may show by calculating the increase in GDP, $60 billion, or

  • because the tax multiplier is smaller than the spending multiplier
